The investigation found that while the initial wave of pizza deliveries may have started organically, it was quickly seized upon by foreign actors.

“The groups that were having the conversations, and in the rooms where we saw the conversations, they tend to be related to the Russian government, or were known to be affiliated and be sympathetic to Russian causes,” he added, referring to, for example, the online forums where the conversations take place. “It’s just a way to destabilize.”
Zayas added that his investigation did not dig deep enough to definitively tie the activity to Russia.
The Russian Embassy in Washington did not respond to a message seeking comment.

Zayas’ company, Ironwall, helps judges scrub their personal information from the internet. Federal judges are already protected under a federal law passed in the aftermath of Anderl’s murder that allows their personal information to be redacted or removed from easily accessible websites that might, for example, show where they live. But Zayas says information can still be available on the dark web.
A Marshals Service spokesperson declined to comment on any potential foreign involvement, saying only that the investigation is ongoing.
Threats rising over the last decade

The Marshals Service has an increasingly large number of threats against judges to investigate. According to the agency’s own data, there were 564 threats against judges in fiscal year 2025 and there have already been 131 since October. A spokesman declined to comment on the current state of any of the investigations.

The number of threats against judges has tripled over the last decade, not just when Trump has been in office, Chief Justice John Roberts said in his annual report on the judiciary last year. NBC News reported in September that some federal judges were upset that Roberts and his colleagues on the Supreme Court had not done enough to stick up for them in the face of the hostile criticism and rise in threats.

Judges who spoke to NBC News for this article do not fault the Marshals Service, which has a tight budget despite the increased burden on its limited resources. While courthouses are secure, judges feel more vulnerable when at home. The Marshals Service helps set up home security, but it does not provide round-the-clock protection at home unless the judge is subject to a specific threat.

As judges wrestle with the additional burdens associated with the job, some of them worry about the longer-term impacts, including on people who might be deterred from seeking judgeships in the future.

“Judges signed up to try their best to be neutral arbiters of the law and to follow precedent, and for it now to be at a point where I have to worry about the safety of my spouse and my children, that changes the entire dynamic,” Bough said.

While Coughenour has found himself a target this year, his main concern is not for his own safety, but that of his younger colleagues who may have children at home, and more broadly the nation as a whole.

“I’m 84 years old. Threats against my life expectancy are kind of hollow. I don’t have much time anyway,” he said. “I’m more concerned that our democracy is at risk because of the trends against the rule of law.”

title: Cannabis reclassification could 'open the floodgates' for research, scientists say
summary: A long-awaited change in drug policy by President Donald Trump could bring scientists one step closer to understanding the harms and benefits of marijuana.
story: A long-awaited change in drug policy could bring scientists one step closer to understanding the harms and benefits of marijuana, the most commonly used federally illegal substance.

On Thursday, President Donald Trump signed an executive order that moved to reclassify cannabis from a Schedule I to a Schedule III substance, following through on a regulatory shift first pushed during the Biden administration.

“Decades of federal drug control policy have neglected marijuana’s medical uses,” the order says. “That oversight has limited the ability of scientists and manufacturers to complete the necessary research on safety and efficacy to inform doctors and patients.”

While the reclassification is intended to bolster medical marijuana research and won’t legalize cannabis at the federal level, the move comes at a time when use in the United States is at a high. Gallup data from 2023 and 2024 estimates that 15% of adults smoke marijuana, up from 7% in 2013.

The poll, which didn’t differentiate between medical and recreational consumption, showed the highest use (19%) among young adults 18 to 34, a group for whom studies have found cannabis to have damaging psychiatric effects. For example, a study published Tuesday in the journal Pediatrics found that using marijuana as little as once or twice a month was linked to emotional distress and worse school performance among teens.

Medical marijuana is typically prescribed to ease chronic pain; control nausea and vomiting, often in people receiving chemotherapy for cancer; and bring about an appetite in people with certain medical conditions. It’s unclear whether rescheduling cannabis will affect funding for recreational marijuana research.
Scientists like Ziva Cooper are hopeful the reclassification could revolutionize public health through more comprehensive marijuana research.

“It is extremely difficult to study cannabis, aka marijuana, for both the potential adverse effects as well as therapeutic effects,” said Cooper, director of the Center for Cannabis and Cannabinoids at the University of California, Los Angeles. “The industry is developing at a very fast pace, and so consumer behavior is developing along with that industry.
“It’s very hard for us, as scientists, as people who are interested in public health, to be able to keep up with the changes, in part because the research is difficult.”

Schedule I is the strictest of the five controlled substance categories recognized by the Drug Enforcement Administration, reserved for drugs “with no currently accepted medical use and a high potential for abuse,” including ecstasy, heroin, LSD and peyote. Schedule III drugs, which include ketamine, testosterone and anabolic steroids, have “a moderate to low potential for physical and psychological dependence,” according to the agency.
Despite working in a cannabis-friendly state, Cooper said she faces the same research hurdles as her peers in states such as Idaho, where no marijuana use is permitted whatsoever.

“Researchers cannot test what is readily available to the market, just basic questions about what is in those products that are available in the dispensary I can see outside of my laboratory window, for example,” Cooper said. “It also means that there are certain restrictions with respect to where we can get our cannabis that we do research on.”
Harms and benefits of marijuana need further study

Last year, the National Institutes of Health awarded $75 million to therapeutic cannabinoid research, up from $70 million in 2023. Additionally, $217 million went to cannabinoids, or cannabis compounds, and $53 million went to cannabidiol, or CBD, a nonpsychoactive cannabinoid.

However, administrative red tape means cannabis studies are often observational, compared with the rigorous clinical trials required of pharmaceutical research, said Dr. Brooke Worster, medical director of the M.S. in medical cannabis science and business program at Thomas Jefferson University in Philadelphia. Their findings have been mixed.

For example, a 2024 study published in the journal Current Alzheimer Research found that recreational cannabis use among adults 45 and older was associated with a 96% lower risk of subjective cognitive decline, compared with nonusers. Yet a 2025 study published in JAMA Network Open found that among adults 22 to 36, heavy cannabis users showed impaired working memory.

Research published this year in the journal Biomedicines suggested cannabinoids are a “promising” alternative to opioids for chronic pain management but cited an urgent need for large-scale, randomized controlled trials. Meanwhile, a study published last year in JAMA Network Open found that older, Medicare-insured adults showed increased rates of health care visits involving cannabis-related disorders from 2017 through 2022.

The reclassification will allow researchers to dispense and study specific formulations of marijuana, Worster said. Now, even in states with medical marijuana programs, the quality and potency of cannabis products can vary greatly between dispensaries.

“We can actively track immediate symptoms or blood levels of things, longer-term effects,” she said. “All the things you’d want to do when you’re studying a medication, all the things that the federal government otherwise requires us to do to study a medication.”

While marijuana may have some medical benefits for some people, Jonathan Caulkins, the H. Guyford Stever university professor of operations research and public policy at Carnegie Mellon University in Pittsburgh, denied that administrative roadblocks have prevented cannabis from curing ailments such as cancer or Alzheimer’s disease.

“They do not restrict research in Canada or France or Israel,” Caulkins said. “I don’t think that we should imagine that the only reason cannabis hasn’t become the wonder drug is because of anything about U.S. law, because we’re not the only country in the world that has a pharmaceutical industry and a research base.”
Still, the change brings new responsibility to the medical community, Worster said, as smoked and inhaled products of any concentration or formulation aren’t safe for everyone.

“What still needs to be figured out is, how do we get the right patient the right medication and the right guidance?” she said. “The products out there are, a lot of times, not regulated. There are real risks with mental health, with youth who use it too regularly, certainly some cardiovascular effects that we need to pay more attention to.”
Cannabis policy to be revised after 55 years
The regulatory hurdles researchers face date back more than half a century. During the Nixon administration, the Controlled Substances Act of 1970 established cannabis as a Schedule I drug.
Nearly 60 years later, much of marijuana’s medical potential, or lack thereof, remains unknown. In the eyes of the law, Worster said, “it is simply a drug of abuse.”

Susan Ferguson, director of the Addictions, Drug and Alcohol Institute at the University of Washington School of Medicine, anticipates scientists will soon have an easier time acquiring cannabis research licenses. Currently, she said, researchers may obtain a broad license to study any Schedule II through V drug. Those who wish to study a Schedule I drug must get a separate license for each substance.

“It involves extensive writing of protocols,” she said. “It involves DEA agents coming out and inspecting the lab and talking to me about the research and the plans for the experiments. It gets very, very complicated.”
Rescheduling marijuana, Ferguson said, would “open the floodgates” for clinical research. For starters, people may be more inclined to enroll in studies of Schedule III rather than Schedule I drugs.
Ferguson likened cannabis to alcohol and tobacco — products that are commonplace but not harmless. Medical research is the reason their harms are well known.
“We haven’t done that research on cannabis,” Ferguson said. “It’ll be able to ultimately tell people what are the risks, what are the benefits, and just give people more information.”

title: Why You Can't Stop Thinking About 'Heated Rivalry' Episode 5
summary: "Heated Rivalry" fans explain why the episode went viral and why its impact has been so widespread. What happened in the episode?
story: Francis Dominic, a content creator based in Los Angeles, watches episodes of “Heated Rivalry” the moment they drop on HBO Max. When he saw the fifth episode, he knew he wanted to watch it again — this time, with a crowd.
“I was like, 'Listen, I have to experience this with people,'” Dominic tells TODAY.com.
Dominic headed to a local gay sports bar that has been airing episodes of the romance novel adaptation since Episode 3, demonstrating the snowball effect the show has had since its Nov. 28 premiere.

In his videos from the evening, the crowd cheers during the last scene as if they were experiencing a live sporting event. Other reactions flooding social media are similarly euphoric, with people saying they're watching it "like it's the Super Bowl."
But why has Episode 5 in particular led to such an outpouring of love? Here’s what to know.
What Is ‘Heated Rivalry’?
Based on Rachel Reid’s "Game Changers" romance novel series, two hockey all-stars fall for each other in “Heated Rivalry.”
Situated within a league that has no openly queer players, Ilya Rozanov (Connor Storrie) and Shane Hollander (Hudson Williams) feel trapped, especially as their feelings for each other grow.
Full of longing and NSFW scenes, the series has been hailed as a perfect romance novel adaptation by fans and has brought new ones into the fold, hence the crowd at Francis’ local bar.
What Happens in Episode 5 of 'Heated Rivalry'?

Episode 5 continues the dramatic highs and lows of Shane and Ilya. Notable moments include Shane ending his relationship with Rose Landry, Shane getting hurt and taken off the ice on a stretcher with a distraught Ilya looking on, and Ilya confessing he loves Shane (that is, in Russian, a monologue that “Heated Rivalry” fans who are native Russian speakers are especially loving.)
But in its final few moments, after four episodes of angst, there's a reprieve, one that fans experienced with joy — and documented for social media.
To explain it, we have to go back to Episode 3, which took a detour from Shane and Ilya’s story to focus on another hockey player, New York star Scott Hunter (Francois Arnaud).

While he’s older than Shane and Ilya, who are both in their mid-20s, he's struggling with the same issue. His meet-cute with an aspiring art historian named Kip (Robbie G.K.) led to a real love, but he feels unable to come out. With Kip tired of living under the shadow of a secret romance, they're at a standstill.

Then comes the ending of Episode 5, when Scott’s New York Admirals win the Stanley Cup. As his teammates embrace friends and family on the ice, Scott moves to the edge of the rink and scans the crowd, looking for someone.

Shane and Ilya watch the moment unfold on the TV. That means the fictional characters and the "Heated Rivalry" audience experience the shock of what Scott does next: He gestures for Kip to come down to the ice. Then, he kisses him on live TV.
Meanwhile, Shane and Ilya seemingly have their own revelations of what this might mean for their relationship.
At the end of the episode, Ilya calls Shane and takes him up on his offer to spend two weeks alone at his home. For the first time in years, they'll have quality together.
The episode ends with Ilya telling Shane, “I’m coming to the cottage.”
Why Is Episode 5 Such a Big Deal?
While “Heated Rivalry” has been building momentum since its premiere, Episode 5 has inspired a particular outpouring of emotion.

Ronald Charles Chavis filmed his husband, Refeal Shtivi, weeping after watching the episode in a video shared to TikTok. Speaking to TODAY.com, the couple say the episode’s “grand gesture” reminded them of their own story. Shtivi was encouraged to come out to the wider world after meeting Chavis in 2023.
“This coming out part in front of so many people, I did myself. I felt like the big release they were having. I felt super connected with that,” Shtivi says.
“Gay, straight — people want to know that they’re loved,” Chavis adds. “That was the beauty in that episode."
Chavis calls the episode “cathartic” for viewers, especially after the four episodes of build-up.

“It was such a such a release for them that everybody watching that episode felt it. Because at one point it felt like we were all holding our breath, waiting, and when he did that, it was like it was a sign that everything was going to be OK,” Chavis says.

Dominic points to the widespread pop culture phenomenon of  LGTBQ love stories ending in tragedy. Instead, at the end of “Heated Rivalry” Episode 5, a gay love story is “loudly celebrated" as the crowd in the stadium cheers, too.

“What was so great about it is that we finally got a huge happily ever after,” Dominic says. “When I watched it by myself, I was sobbing, because it’s like we are constantly fighting for our happily ever after.”
For Dominic, Episode 5’s ending is meta, with consequences reverberating both in the show and in the real world.

“I think seeing Scott choose Kip and bringing him on the ice was so triumphant, because sometimes that just never happens either in real life or in media portraits of gays in their relationship,” he says.
“Hopefully people will be inspired to live the truth that they’ve always wanted to," he said. "If this is what’s happening right now mainstream media, I’m like, why can’t it happen in real life?”

title: Sophia James Looks Back at 1 of the Biggest Moments of 2025 — Which She Created
summary: Sophia James opens up about life after Group 7 and her new album.
story: Singer-songwriter Sophia James is responsible for one of the major internet moments of 2025: Group 7, a social media experiment that went extremely viral.
Back in October, James posted seven TikTok videos assigning people to groups one through seven, with her her single “So Unfair" playing in the background.
Thanks to the mystery of the algorithm, one of the videos went off. “If you’re watching this video, you are in group 7,” James said in the 7th video, which amassed 85.6 million views.
What followed was not just a viral moment, but a turning point for James' career, leading to a New York Times profile an in-person group 7 event in Los Angeles.
What comes after group 7? A lot, James says.
Life before and after ‘group 7’
Before her viral moment, James describes her career as an independent artist as “pretty stagnant.”

She graduated from UCLA with a degree in jazz. “I just knew that I wanted to do music my whole life,” she tells TODAY.com. “I figured if I had a good understanding of jazz theory and practice, I could translate it easily to whatever genre I chose.”
Since college, she has worked all over the music industry, from session pianist to backup vocalist to touring opener and keyboardist.
“I’ve had my hands in about 10 different pies at any given point, with the intention of making the solo artist career full-time,” James says.

As an independent artist, social media was the "only tool in her arsenal" for getting her own music out into the world — but she did not expect her impulsive batch of videos to blow up. She says she was “just trying things and feeling silly,” so she was shocked when the seventh video took off.

This journey and group 7 have not only changed her goals, but the scale of her audience and the reach of her music. James gained over 100,000 TikTok followers after going viral, according to The New York Times.

The viral moment also helped James catch the attention of SiriusXM’s Mikey Piff, who discovered her song “So Unfair” through the group 7 video. James explains that Piff emailed her asking to play her on the station.
“I was like, that’s crazy — I never, ever thought I would ever have a song on the radio,” James says. “I consider that the pinnacle of a music career.”
James says “So Unfair” then transferred over to the Hits 1 station because of the positive response to the song.
“And so that’s been really unbelievable and very massive,” James says.
Still, life after group 7 can come with pressure. James says she has felt some expectations to recreate the viral success, but she knows it was a “lightning in a bottle” moment.
“I will never top the group 7 video, at least on social media,” she says. “That is my magnum opus on social media.”
New year, new music

James says if people want more excitement, they should turn to her music. Instead of chasing another viral hit, James is focused on building her future. She says her upcoming album, to be released in 2026, represents a creative shift.
“It’s definitely the most explorative I’ve ever been in music,” she explains. “It’s very absurd and playful in a lot of ways, and it’s been really fun to explore that side of artistry.”
James says earlier songs were more “deeply existential and grim,” where the new album is a lot more “explosive.” She feels all the feelings, ranging from anger to humor.
“To be an artist you don’t have to be tortured,” James says. “You can also be a trickster, you can be playful and excited and angry.”

These feelings in her music are inspired by lived experience, relationships and music she’s listened to across eras. In her mind, these are songs that could be enjoyed and on the radio 15 years ago or 15 years from now.
Much of her upcoming album was shaped by the two years she spent writing it, a period filled with “a lot of living.”
“I feel like I have the freedom to dream bigger than I have felt like I was allowed to in a long while,” James says.
Going forward, James hopes to spend as much time on the road as possible. “I want to tour forever,” she says. “So come hang.”
In other words — we're all in group 7 now.

title: The Best Books to Read This December, According to John Searles
summary: There's nothing like than cozying up with a book in holiday pajamas, the glow of a Christmas tree and crackle of an roaring fire creating the perfect mood.
story: There's nothing like than cozying up with a book in holiday pajamas, the glow of a Christmas tree and crackle of an roaring fire creating the perfect mood.

To make the most of this peak reading environment, author John Searles, who is releasing his next book "Single Girls" in July 2026, has readers covered with the top book recommendations this holiday season.
Keep reading to discover his picks, which he shared on the 3rd Hour of TODAY, and what he has to say about each book.
"The Holiday Grump" by Enni Amanda

Taking place in the cozy small-town of Hideaway Harbor, a runaway bride and a bookseller are friends with benefits until the line starts to blur. Perfect for fans of grump/sunshine and forced proximity.

"This sweet and spicy tale has all the key ingredients for a fun holiday love story," Searles says, including "a runaway bride," "a grumpy but gorgeous bookstore owner" and "a cozy town with more Christmas decorations per square foot than a Hallmark movie."
When Noelle leaves her husband-to-be behind and ends up in the small town of Hideaway Harbor with a gig selling Christmas bulbs for the season, she ends up connecting with a bookstore owner.
"Good Spirits" by B.K. Borison
This twist on A Christmas Carol explores the idea of the Ghost of Christmas Past as the love interest in a rom com.
In this book, a woman is hosted by the Ghost of Christmas Past ... but he's not anything like the depiction from Charles Dickens' "Christmas Carol."

"In this book, the ghost is a quietly handsome and rugged former sailor named Nolan, who’s caught between this life and the next and given the job of haunting people and showing them their past," Searles says. "When he meets a sweet and charming woman named Harriet, he finds himself suddenly wishing for a future…with her."
"A Christmas Carol (Deluxe Gift Edition)" by Charles Dickens
In this classic Christmas tale, Ebenezer Scrooge hates Christmas until three ghosts bring him to pivotal moments throughout his life to show him the true meaning of Christmas.
Discover the Christmas classic with Peter Pauper Press, whohas published this deluxe gift edition with classic illustrations.

"Dickens was known to be a social critic and it’s clear he intended this story to also be a commentary on the divide between the rich and the poor, which is felt more acutely during the holiday season," Searles says.
"The Polar Express: 40th Anniversary Edition" by Chris Van Allsburg

A young boy hops a train to the North Pole for the ultimate adventure to learn the true spirit of Christmas. This book was also, of course, adapted into a beloved holiday film to watch after reading the book.
"The movie has become such a holiday classic that I think some people out there don’t even realize it was originally based on a gorgeous children’s book," Searles says.
The original book has a "quiet magic" about it. Venture along as a young boy discovers a train to the North Pole outside his house.
"The Award" by Matthew Pearl
This thrilling page-turner about how a struggling author navigates fame in the literary world will have readers on the edge of their seats.
"We all know tensions can flare at a holiday party… but in this captivating thriller, the tension is so ratcheted up it leads to a shocking murder," Searles says.
"A dark, gripping read. I cracked it open on a long plane ride and did not stop until I finished. I loved it."

title: Taylor Swift Reads Aloud a Romantic Letter from Travis Kelce in 'Eras Tour' Doc. What It Says
summary: In the finale episode of "The End of an Era" docuseries, Taylor Swift reads aloud a note that Travis Kelce wrote her.
story: Taylor Swift is sharing a sneak peek at a sweet note Travis Kelce wrote her ahead of her final “Eras Tour” concerts.

In the final episode of her six-part “The End of an Era” docuseries, the pop star gets nostalgic as she wraps a special era on the road. As emotions run high, her Kansas City Chiefs star fiancé sends her a message telling her how thankful he is for the record-breaking tour that brought them together.
Backstage in her green room, with just three shows left, Swift sits on a couch next to a bouquet of white roses and reads a letter Kelce wrote her.

“So many unbelievable memories on this tour, but my favorite one is seeing you in concert for the first time, being ... mesmerized and swept off my feet by a woman who doesn’t even know me,” she quotes with a laugh, reading the note out loud. “I selfishly say thank you for creating this legendary tour and to Robert for making you stop through Kansas City, Missouri.”
“That night, too, in KC, was the beginning of me meeting the love of my life...” she continues, before reading the rest to herself.
After reading it, she says, “Ohhh, my god. So much for no emotions on the last three shows, huh?”

As Swifties know, the Chiefs tight end attended Swift's concert at his team’s home stadium in July 2023. Then during his “New Heights” podcast, he shared that he tried and failed to give Swift a bracelet with his phone number on it.
Behind the scenes, the two started connecting and rumors of a romance brewing ignited when Swift attended her first Chiefs game in September 2023.
Just over two years after Kelce attended that fateful Swift concert, the pair announced their engagement in August 2025.
During Swift’s first appearance on “New Heights," Swift touched on how the podcast and her tour brought them together.
“This podcast has done a lot for me. I owe a lot to this podcast. This podcast got me a boyfriend ever since Travis decided to use it as his personal dating app about two years ago,” she joked.
When Kelce's brother, Jason Kelce, asked if she ever got the bracelet Travis Kelce made for her, she replied, “I’ve never seen the original.”

“It was such a wild romantic gesture to just be like, ‘I want to date you!’” she said, later adding, “This is sort of what I’ve been writing songs about wanting to happen to me since I was a teenager.”

title: 'Heated Rivalry' Is Getting People Into Hockey. Here's What the NHL Thinks
summary: “Heated Rivalry” is one of the must-see shows of the season, bringing hockey fans and those who weren’t as familiar with the sport together to watch two rival hockey players fall in love.
story: “Heated Rivalry” is one of the must-see shows of the season, bringing hockey fans and those who weren’t as familiar with the sport together to watch two rival hockey players fall in love.

The steamy drama, based on the 2019 romance book by Rachel Reid, originally aired on the Canadian platform Crave before appearing on HBO Max in the U.S. and Australia. The show’s audience has continued to grow over the last month, turning the series into a global phenomenon.

But how does the NHL feel about “Heated Rivalry”? In a recent interview with The Hollywood Reporter, a league rep said about the hit series, “There are so many ways to get hooked on hockey and, in the NHL’s 108-year history, this might be the most unique driver for creating new fans.”
The rep added, “See you all at the rink.”

The Season 1 finale, titled “The Cottage” arrives on HBO Max on Friday, Dec. 26 at 12 a.m. PT (or 9 p.m. PT on Dec. 25), concluding the six-episode season. But thankfully for fans, more hockey and romance are on the way.
Creator Jacob Tierney and executive producer Brendan Brady confirmed in a statement earlier this month that the show has been renewed for a second season.

“Watching our show become an international phenomenon has been extraordinary. We’re profoundly grateful to everyone that has been on this journey with us,” they wrote. “Being renewed for a second season so early is a true honor, and we can’t wait to bring you even more of what you love.”

So far, “Heated Rivalry” has closely followed the way Shane (played by Hudson Williams on the show) and Ilya’s (portrayed by Connor Storrie) love story unfolds in Reid’s book. The author also penned a 2022 sequel called “The Long Game.”
When she spoke to TODAY.com, Reid said that she is always thinking of ways to continue Shane and Ilya’s story.
“I have story ideas for them that I’ve been working on,” she shared. “They never leave my head.”
Reid added, “Some of them I’m working on, I’m trying to figure out what to do with them, but there’s going to be something. You’ll see something for sure.”

In the show, and the book, the romance between the two rival hockey players takes place over the span of eight years, from Shane and Ilya’s time going head-to-head as rookies to when they compete at the Olympics.
The first five episodes of the season are available to stream on HBO Max now.

title: Watch Matt Rogers and His Incredible Mustache Make Their 'Palm Royale' Debut: EXCLUSIVE
summary: Matt Rogers makes his guest appearance on Season 2 of "Palm Royale." TODAY.com has your first look in an exclusive clip.
story: Warning: Spoilers ahead for Season 2 of “Palm Royale.”
Matt Rogers has officially made his way to the Palm Royale.
As the second season of the Apple TV show continues to surprise fans with more twists and turns, TODAY.com has your first look at the actor and comedian making his “Palm Royale” debut.

Rogers portrays Bruce in the upcoming seventh episode, dropping on Christmas Eve. And while not much is known about his character, the sneak peek shows him already befriending Kristen Wiig’s quirky character Maxine.
The clip begins with both of them sitting in a convertible as they look at who’s arriving at a funeral held at the country club.
“Look who just zipped up on his vespa,” Rogers as Bruce says, while he zooms in on Ricky Martin’s character Robert. He then gets distracted by another man, who he calls his “rock.”
“And he’s with Reagan,” Bruce adds, while Maxine asks, “The governor of California?”
“No, his wife. She’s Rock’s best Judy,” Bruce quips.
When Maxine says that she thinks the woman’s name is Nancy, Bruce tells her, “You have a lot to learn.”
When Maxine notices the casket being taken out of the hearse, she says she needs to give her twin sister Mirabelle “a proper goodbye.”
Bruce tells her she’ll never get in through the front door, but Maxine tells him, “If there’s one thing I know how to do, it’s sneak into the Palm Royale.”

As viewers saw in the previous episode, Maxine discovered that she had a long lost twin named Mirabelle who suddenly showed up at the Delacorte residence. While Maxine was elated to have a sister, Mirabelle turned out to be a con artist and even slept with Douglas (Josh Lucas), who thought she was Maxine.

Things only got more interesting after Norma (Carol Burnett) told Robert that she was out to get Maxine. The sixth episode ended with Mirabelle dead after someone shot her. But who killed her and did they think it was Maxine?
Fans will get to learn more about who was behind the murder, as well as be introduced to Rogers' character.
Back in October while co-hosting TODAY with Jenna & Friends, Rogers touched on his upcoming cameo and his stylish thick mustache.
“That was me in the hot tub with the mustache,” he said, while Jenna Bush Hager said she at first didn’t recognize him. “That’s me kind of being the king of the motel.”

As photos of him in costume appeared on screen, Rogers added, “The ‘Palm Royale’ hair and makeup and costume team, they matched that car to my shirt. I’ve never experienced anything like this... There’s me and Kristen... She is a dream and we have such a fun time together.”
“The cast is truly brilliant,” he continued, adding that this season was even better than the last. “I’m going to give you a little Christmas gift. The gift of my mustache.”
Season 2’s Episode 7, titled “Maxine Plays Dead,” drops Wednesday, Dec. 24 on Apple TV.

title: Michael Bolton's Daughters Reveal How He's Doing Now After Brain Cancer Diagnosis
summary: Michael Bolton's daughters share update on the singer's health two years after he was diagnosed with glioblastoma, an aggressive from of brain cancer.
story: Michael Bolton is in “very good spirits and very good health” two years after being diagnosed with glioblastoma, an aggressive form of brain cancer, the singer’s daughters shared in a health update.

“He has a lot of challenges, and we do have great days and some tough days, but in general, he’s very strong. His mobility and cognition have been terrific. So, we’re in a really good place right now,” Isa Bolton, 50, told the AARP in an interview that was published on Dec. 19.
“He’s generally in a really good mood and just like excited for the day,” added Taryn Bolton, 46, in a video accompanying the article.

Michael Bolton learned that he had glioblastoma in December 2023 after undergoing emergency surgery to remove a brain tumor. He had a second brain surgery in January 2024 to treat an infection, then received radiation and chemotherapy.
The Grammy Award-winning singer, who is now 72, told the AARP via email that he’s “feeling deeply grateful,” but added that “this past year has tested me in ways I never imagined.”
His daughters called the diagnosis “overwhelming” and “devastating.”
What Illness Is Michael Bolton Suffering From?

Bolton has glioblastoma, the most common and deadliest type of brain cancer, according to the National Brain Tumor Society. The median survival is nine months from diagnosis, with only 7% of glioblastoma patients living more than five years, it notes.

The cancer is aggressive and difficult to treat because it grows tentacles into the brain rather than forming a solid mass. There is no cure. Uche Ojeh, the husband of TODAY co-host Sheinelle Jones, died of glioblastoma in May 2025. He was 45.
Glioblastoma symptoms include persistent headaches, double vision, changes in mood, memory problems and coordination issues.

One of Bolton’s warning signs was a fall. The emergency brain surgery that followed left him with a “significant personality change,” alarming his grandchildren, though he’s mostly back to being himself, Isa Bolton said. His treatment includes yoga and physical therapy.
The singer’s three adult daughters — from his marriage to ex-wife  Maureen McGuire — have become his caregivers.

Taryn Bolton lives with him full-time in his home in Westport, Connecticut. Isa Bolton is there three days a week, while Holly Bolton, 48, flies in one week each month. Caregiving can leave a person burnt out, sad and lonely, Taryn Bolton said, advising the millions of others in the same situation to take time to take care of themselves, too.
Is Michael Bolton Still Performing?

The singer is no longer performing, but the family has grown closer since Bolton — who is known for hits such as “Soul Provider” and spent decades traveling the world on concert tours — was forced to slow down due to his health issues.

“He’s been home for two years, recovering,” Isa Bolton told the AARP. “He’s with one of his children or multiple children and grandchildren for all of his meals. We probably had more meals with him in two years than we have had our entire [lives].”
Bolton said his daughters help him stay centered.
“They remind me of who I am and what’s worth fighting for,” he told the AARP via email.
The singer also thanked his fans for their messages and prayers.

“It’s amazing how a few words from someone you’ve never met can lift your spirit and steady your steps. It reminds me that we’re all connected, and none of us walk through life’s challenges alone,” he wrote.

title: Why Is Bowen Yang Leaving SNL? Read His Full Statement
summary: Bowen Yang is shedding some light on his surprising exit from "Saturday Night Live." What he's said about why he's leaving.
story: Bowen Yang is shedding some light on his surprising exit from "Saturday Night Live."
The comedian shocked many viewers when news of his sudden departure spread on Dec. 19, a day before his final episode.
After joining "SNL" as a writer in 2018, Yang became an on-air featured player a year later during Season 45. In Season 47, he was promoted to the main cast.

Yang is leaving in the middle of his eighth season with the show. Three months before, several other "SNL" cast members exited, including Ego Nwodim, Heidi Gardner, Michael Longfellow, Devon Walker and Emil Wakim.

During his last "SNL" skit, Yang was joined by his "Wicked" co-star Ariana Grande and the episode's musical guest, Cher, playing a retiring airline employee and providing a meta glimpse at his surprising departure.
What Bowen Yang Has Said About Leaving 'SNL'
Following his last episode of "SNL," Yang shared a statement on Instagram Dec. 21.

"I loved working at SNL, and most of all i loved the people. i was there at a time when many things in the world started to seem futile, but working at 30 rock taught me the value in showing up anyway when people make it worthwhile," he wrote.

The 35-year-old said he was "grateful for every minute" of his experience on the show and expressed his gratitude for "every single person who showed up there," including the cast, crew staff and more.

"Thank you to Lorne (Michaels) for the job. for the standard. and for bringing everyone at work together. they all care deeply about people in the room, any room, enjoying themselves. i can’t believe i was ever included in that," he wrote.
Yang also gave a special shoutout to Grande, writing, "thank you to ari for sending me off in the dreamiest way i could imagine."
The comedian ended his statement with the following message: "the show doesn’t go on because it’s ready, but s---, i hope i am. ❤️🌃⌛️🎥."

Reflecting on his final “SNL” episode, Yang shared another message on his Instagram story. He posted a photo of a Mario Kart player on the game’s infamous Rainbow Road track, and wrote, "all day felt like this yesterday."

“Slightly perilous but then reached the full sublime. a train of waving friends riding alongside??? it was seeing and hearing from so many people whose love overwhelmed me to tears. i will never experience anything like that in my life,” he continued.
Bowen Yang Got Emotional During His Last Sketch
During the Dec. 20 episode, Yang appeared in his final sketch with Kenan Thompson, Ariana Grande and Cher.
Yang played an airline employee who was preparing for retirement. Throughout the skit, he sang a duet of “Please Come Home for Christmas” with Grande.
As Thompson appeared in the sketch, he wished Yang "good luck" and said he was going to miss him.
"I'll miss you too, Kenan Thompson," Yang replied with a laugh.
As Grande said she couldn't believe Yang's character was retiring, he said, "I just wanted to go out on top."

And while in character, Yang grew emotional and began to cry as he delivered the following line: "I just feel so lucky that I ever got to work here, and I just wanted to enjoy it for a little bit longer, especially the people. I've loved every single person who works here because they've done so much for me, especially my boss."
"This place will always be home, but it's time to go," he later added.

title: Iyanla Vanzant Returns to TV with New OWN Series. See the 1st Trailer
summary: Iyanla Vanzant returns to OWN with a new series called “Iyanla: The Inside Fix.” See the first trailer.
story: After a few years away, Iyanla Vanzant is returning to OWN with a new series called “Iyanla: The Inside Fix.”

The 72-year-old life coach, author and television personality previously hosted and produced her last OWN show, “Iyanla: Fix My Life,” from 2012 to 2021. Each of the 136 episodes that aired over 10 seasons ended with an update that reviewed to viewers on how each guest had progressed since meeting Vanzant.
Now, she is reuniting with the network for a series that will revisit twelve of the guests she helped heal in the original show.

“There comes a moment when fixing the outside is no longer enough,” Vanzant said in a statement. “This is the moment where the noise fades, the demands disappear, the people disappear, and the only work left is the work within. This is where healing becomes holy. This is where truth finds its home. This… is The Inside Fix.”

OWN shared more about what fans can expect in a press release. “‘The Inside Fix’ will uncover new truths, explore fresh takeaways from these powerful stories, and, most importantly, carve out new practices for good 'spiritual hygiene' in the pursuit of a renewed sense of self and being. The new series promises to show that the deep work of becoming our best self is never truly finished,” the network said.

The first episode of “Iyanla: The Inside Fix” will air Saturday, Jan. 17 at 8 p.m. ET/PT on the network. TODAY.com has an exclusive reveal of the trailer which shares glimpses of the cases Vanzant will be reminiscing about.
“I’ve come to unpack. Not this,” she explains in the teaser while pointing to a suitcase. “That...”
The clip then shows some of the unforgettable moments from “Fix My Life,” like the famous “Not on my watch” interaction.

“I am revisiting the stories, the teachings and the wisdom of ‘Fix My Life’ to recapture and share the lessons with new eyes,” she says about her new show. “To examine the insights with greater clarity and to offer guidance and practices that will help us all do our work for the times we are living in today.”
She notes that the world was drastically different when her last show premiered in 2012.  “Time has shifted me. Time has shifted us all,” she adds.
But, Vanzant says the constant has been the need for healing.
“Let the healing begin,” she says before getting to work.
See the full trailer below.

title: Hospital Staff Bring a 12-Year-Old Swiftie to a State of Shock: 'I Cried and I Laughed'
summary: Hospital staff surprised Taylor Swift superfan Henry Hinson, who has spina bifida, with a custom song.
story: If you ask 12-year-old Henry Hinson how long he’s been a Taylor Swift fan, he’ll tell you “since the womb.” And his mom, Erin Hinson, will confirm it’s true.
“I used to put headphones on my belly when he was a baby, and I would listen to ‘Fearless’ and I would listen to ‘Speak Now,’” Hinson tells TODAY.com.

When she was 20 weeks pregnant, Henry was diagnosed with spina bifida, a condition where the spine doesn’t form properly, according to the Mayo Clinic. To manage the stress, Hinson would sing “Long Live” at the top of her lungs, and she says she'd feel Henry dancing inside her.
More than a decade later, that love for Swift would help carry Henry through many of the hardest moments of his young life.

A TikTok video of hospital staff surprising the young superfan with a Swift song customized just for him has gone viral. Henry’s child life specialist and nursing team Riley Hospital for Children in Indianapolis, Indiana serenaded him with a version of  “The Life of a Showgirl” reimagined as “The Life of Henry.”
“You have been the life of 9 West and have brought so much joy to all of us and all of our patients and our other families, so we have a little surprise for you,” one staff member says in the video.

Some eagle-eyed Swifties may recognize Henry from a first viral moment 2024, when his Halloween costume caught the attention of Swift’s team, leading to an invitation to the "Eras Tour" where he and his mom got to meet Swift’s mother, Andrea Swift.
The idea for a custom song came from Maddie Rodriguez, Henry’s certified child life specialist, who formed an instant bond with him when they first met.
“The first thing he said to me was, ‘Are you a Swiftie?’ which obviously I am,” Rodriguez tells TODAY.com. “So it made the relationship just so natural and gave us something to talk about.”

When Henry’s mom told the hospital staff that they’d had to miss their planned at-home “Eras Tour” documentary watch party due to his hospitalization, Rodriguez knew she had to do something special for him.
“That’s just part of being a child life specialist, trying to celebrate our kids during really hard times and bringing these personalized moments to them,” she says.
Hospital staffers threw an all-day party for Henry, with Hinson's help — she bought cupcakes, special decorations and giant friendship bracelets to share with other young Swifties in the hospital.

Swift's music played in his room throughout the day, and Henry called in staff members when their favorite songs came on. His doctors joined in, too, wearing their heart-shaped glasses and dancing. “He just had a really great day,” Hinson says.

It culminated in a performance of “The Life of Henry.” Set to the backing track of the album’s titular song, the team launched into their personalized lyrics celebrating everything that makes Henry special.
“Working with him these last three weeks and getting to know who he is as Henry first, because he is Henry before a patient,” Rodriguez explains. “I just thought of all of his favorite things.”
Henry’s reaction? “I was in shock, like I cried and laughed,” he tells TODAY.com. His favorite part of the song was “when they talked about me liking Swig and 67.”

“I don’t know that they will ever understand the impact that that had on Henry, and on me,” Hinson says. “Because they didn’t just offer medical care that day. It wasn’t just them doing their jobs. They saw Henry.”

The viral performance came during a particularly challenging time for Henry, who has undergone 25 surgeries related to his condition. The week before Thanksgiving, Henry was hospitalized after going into septic shock and required surgery and time on a ventilator as his body fought infection.
“His bravery, in my opinion, is unmatched,” Hinson says, her voice catching with emotion. “He faces a lot of really big, scary things.”
For Henry, Swift’s music serves as more than entertainment, it’s a lifeline during scary moments.

“When he is scared, when he has to go to the CT machine or he’s going back into surgery, all somebody has to do is say, ‘Well, tell me about the time you went to the Eras Tour,' and he’s instantly transported into this place that’s safe and secure and that he understands. It just makes his days inside of this hospital a little bit easier," she says.
Henry now watches the video of the performance regularly, and his mom catches him humming his own personalized version of the song.
She tells both her sons — Henry and his 15-year-old brother, Oliver— that “joy is a choice we make every day.”
“In the hard times, it’s especially important that we choose joy, that we look for joy, because it is what sustains us. And so for Henry, he oozes it. He literally oozes joy,” she says.

The viral attention has inspired Henry and his family to give back. When Hinson told Henry that the TikTok video was starting to earn money through the creator fund, “he didn’t miss a beat and he said, ‘Mom, I think we should donate it back to the hospital. You know, they’re the reason we’re getting it,’” she recalls.
Both Henry and his brother Oliver asked their mom to create an Amazon wish list for the child life team at Riley instead of receiving gifts for themselves for the holidays this year.

“They both were like, ‘Mom, we have enough stuff,’” Hinson says. The public wish list includes items like Lip Smackers chapstick, which child life specialists use to coat the inside of anesthesia masks so kids smell strawberry or chocolate instead of a sterile operating room.

“Child life specialists often work with a very limited budget, but the work they do is so incredibly important,” Hinson explains. “I’m just incredibly grateful that the internet gets to see the work that really goes into loving children through critical illness.”

title: What Time Does 'Landman' Come Out? How to Watch Season 2, Episode 6
summary: What time does Landman come out? Here's when Landman Season 2, Episode 6 comes on on December 21.
story: Season 2 of "Landman" is heating up.
As the Paramount+ series inches closer to the end of its sophomore season, the stakes are getting higher for many of its characters.
Eager to tune in to Episode 6? Here’s everything you need to know to check out all the action.
What Time Does Episode 6 of ‘Landman’ Premiere?
New episodes of “Landman” premiere exclusively on Paramount+ on Sundays.
Season 2, Episode 6 of “Landman” lands on Paramount+ at 12 a.m. ET on Sunday, Dec. 21.
What Will Happen in Episode 6?

In Season 2 Episode 6, titled "Dark Night of the Soul," Tommy (Billy Bob Thornton) will negotiate a “risky offshore drilling deal,” per the episode description, while tensions rise with Cami (Demi Moore), the CEO of M-Tex Oil.
Meanwhile, Cooper "seeks a blessing from Ariana's family."
Is ‘Landman’ Renewed for Season 3?

There are 10 episodes total in Season 2, so many fans of “Landman” are already wondering if the popular series will return for a third season. Luckily, Paramount has already announced that the series has been renewed.
"Landman" is set in West Texas and follows both roughnecks and millionaires in the midst of an oil boom.

title: The Sweet Role Ashley Park Played at Lily Collins’ Wedding
summary: Emily in Paris co-stars and best friends Lily Collins and Ashley Park talk about their relationship and share exclusively the role Ashley played at Lily's wedding.
story: When Lily Collins and Ashley Park met while filming "Emily in Paris," they may not have predicted their onscreen friendship would transform into a lasting bond in real life.
Now, the co-stars call themselves best friends and Park even played a special role at Collins' wedding to Charlie McDowell in 2021.
“Ashley sang at our wedding,” Collins told TODAY lifestyle contributor Jill Martin during an interview in Venice while promoting Season 5 of their hit Netflix series.

“It was for a really meaningful part of the ceremony, and that was probably the most nervous and honored I’ve ever been,” Park, who is also a Tony-nominated performer, told TODAY.com in a separate interview.
“Her voice was absolutely stunning,” Collins added.
Park, who plays Mindy Chen in "Emily in Paris," first met her co-star turned bestie when Collins had recently started dating her now-husband.

"I saw her get engaged, then she got married, and now she’s a mom. So for me, I can’t believe we get to do this. And yes, we’re in Venice, but it’s really cool to do with your best friend," she told Martin.
Collins feels the same way and said she developed a strong connection with Park immediately after meeting her.
“It was a magnetic experience right away — like soul sistership right off the bat,” she said.
For Collins, getting to share in the success of "Emily in Paris" with her bestie makes life even sweeter.

"When you’re doing it with a best friend and like a sister, it becomes a life experience that I don’t think we were expecting back then," she said. "It's more than just a show. It’s like this has been our lives for six years, and we’ve gone through so many ups and downs together that this feels like a celebration of not only just like a fifth season, but of the sisterhood, and that’s really special."
"We feel so grounded with each other," Park added.
Collins and Park have become so embedded in each other's lives that they have an inexplicable connection, according to Collins.
"We always start crying when we get emotional because if (Park) feels something, I feel it. It’s very strange," she said.
“You were in Copenhagen, like last week, and we were talking about something. I can feel any sort of emotion from her and vice versa. And we feel it even from across the world,” Park added.

title: Taylor Swift Reflects on Her 2 Breakups Before Meeting Travis Kelce: ‘Rough Time in My Life’
summary: Taylor Swift offered unprecedented insight into the heartbreak she experienced before meeting her now fiancé, Travis Kelce.
story: Taylor Swift offered unprecedented insight into the heartbreak she experienced before meeting her now fiancé, Travis Kelce.

In Episode 4 of her Disney + docuseries “The End of an Era,” the singer recalled the early days of her relationship with Kelce and said she met him after experiencing two breakups on the first half of her “Eras Tour.”

Swifties will recall that Swift dated actor Joe Alwyn for more than six and a half years before reports of their breakup started to surface in April 2023. Swift was also linked to musician Matty Healy the same year.

In the docuseries, the 36-year-old called writing music “a form of therapy” and opened up about the moody vibe of her 2024 album, “The Tortured Poets Department,” saying it was a “purge of everything bad” she felt in her life for two years.

“It was a really rough time in my life, so the songs reflect that,” she said. “Feeling like I’m not a person, I’m just this big conglomerate that no one sees as a real human being and especially not men that I date. And in the whole process just being like, ‘Nothing works. There’s no one for me in the world.’”
Later in the episode, Swift recalled going through two breakups in the first half of the “Eras Tour.”
“And that’s a lot of breakups, actually,” she said.
Throughout the heartbreak, the singer said the tour helped sustain her.

“There were points in this tour when the tour was the only thing that was really keeping me going in my life. But there were never points in the tour where I thought, ‘Oh, you know what? I want to quit the tour because the tour’s hard.’ No, my personal life was hard,” Swift said.
For Swift, the tour gave her purpose and helped get her out of bed, she said.
“The tour has been the thing that has allowed me to find purpose outside of the s--- that was going on in my life,” she added. “Men will let you down. The ‘Eras Tour’ never will.”
In the same episode, Swift opened up about the experience of meeting Kelce and called their relationship the “greatest surprise of my life.”
The singer noted that, in the past, she always had a hard time balancing her personal and professional life while she was touring — but Kelce made it easy this time around.

“I don’t think I thought I’d ever meet a guy who had that same (career) trajectory. And I realized that with this person in my life that just was the right fit for me. You can have the two passions coexist and they actually fuel each other,” she said.
Swift said that she’s grateful Kelce is up for the challenge of living a “big life.”

“Travis is just very comfortable with, conceptually speaking, a big life, because he has one and it’s not one that he has reluctantly. He’s very comfortable with it,” she said. “I think, ultimately, it’s the way he treats me. It’s very clear. And I think that’s one of the reasons the fans are so in love with him. Because you should be. You know, he’s very lovable.”

title: Timothée Chalamet Raps With EsDeeKid After Rumors That He's the Mysterious Rapper
summary: Timothée Chalamet is seemingly responding to the rumors that the viral masked rapper EsDeeKid is his alter ego
story: Timothée Chalamet is seemingly responding to the rumors that the viral masked rapper EsDeeKid is his alter ego.
The Oscar nominee, who turns 30 on Dec. 27, appears rapping alongside the anonymous Liverpool-based hip-hop star in the official video for the EsDeeKid’s new track “4 Raws Remix,” released Dec. 19.

In the clip, which both entertainers shared to Instagram, the duo dress in EsDeeKid’s uniform of hoodies and bandanas that carefully obscure his face. Together, they rap the song’s lyrics while dancing inside a convenience store.

At one point, Chalamet pulls his hoodie away from his face to rap a few boastful verses that refer to both his Hollywood career and his real-life girlfriend Kylie Jenner, whose billionaire status has made headlines.
“It’s Timothée Chalamet chillin’, tryin’ to stack $100 million / Girl got a billion / What the f---, what a wonderful feeling,” he raps.
He later adds, “My life is an opera, look at the Oscars, look at the groupies, look at the movies.”
The Oscar nominee also name-checks his new movie “Marty Supreme” multiple times throughout the song.
Who Is EsDeeKid and Why Do People Think He's Timothée Chalamet's Alter Ego?
EsDeeKid is an English rapper from Liverpool who is known for not revealing his face. Keeping his identity a secret, only his eyes are shown behind a mask and hoodie.
Rumors about Chalamet being the secret identity of EsDeeKid began soon after the rapper’s debut album “Rebel” arrived in June.
People online have also noticed the resemblance between both of the artists’ eyes.
“Those are Chalament eyes,” Willie Geist said during the Dec. 17 Today with Jenna & Friends episode, with Jenna Bush Hager adding, “That looks like Chalamet’s eyes.”
At the time, they both agreed it was the actor, while Rachel Smith did not think they were the same person.
When Chalamet was directly asked to confirm the rumors during a Dec. 11 interview on the British radio program “Heart Breakfast,” the actor played coy.
“All will be revealed in due time,” he teased.

As people get more answers (and continue to be confused), both he and a tagged EsDeeKid also appeared together in a photo shared by artist Archie Erskine on Instagram following the release of their song.

Chalamet, however, is known for his ties to music, portraying Bob Dylan in last year’s “A Complete Unknown” and singing in “Wonka.” The actor has also previously adopted a persona to perform as a rapper.
In a viral video from 2012, the actor can be seen rapping under the moniker Lil Timmy Tim at an event at his then-high school, LaGuardia High School in New York City.
He’s also poked fun at his former rapper self in a couple of “Saturday Night Live” sketches.

title: 'The Housemaid' Stars Sydney Sweeney and Amanda Seyfried Break Down That Jaw-Dropping Ending
summary: "The Housemaid" movie starring Sydney Sweeney and Amanda Seyfried is one thrilling ride that has a twisted ending. The stars explains what happens at the end.
story: Warning: Graphic spoilers for the movie “The Housemaid” ahead.
You may think you know who the bad guy is in “The Housemaid,” but the shocking twist halfway through the movie will have you questioning everything.

“The Housemaid” stars Sydney Sweeney as Millie, a woman recently released from prison on parole, and Amanda Seyfried, a housewife named Nina Winchester who is looking to hire a live-in housemaid for her and husband Andrew's (Brandon Sklenar) seemingly picture-perfect home in a suburb of New York City.
Directed by Paul Feig, the director of the films “A Simple Favor” and “Bridesmaids,” the story is based on the book by the same name and written by Freida McFadden.
When strange things begin to happen at the house, Millie thinks that she understands what is happening. Little does she know that everything is not as it seems.
“Shocking,” Seyfried describes the movie to TODAY.com, while Sweeney adds, “Suspenseful and crazy, roller coaster, wild, genre-bending.”
Below, actors Sydney Sweeney and Amanda Seyfried, as well as director Paul Feig, break down the jaw-dropping ending.
What Happens in ‘The Housemaid’?

When Millie is first hired as the housemaid for the Winchester family, she thinks she landed the perfect job. Her tasks include cleaning up the home and taking care of the family's seemingly spoiled daughter, Cece (Indiana Elle). She is given a room in the attic to live in, even though the door strangely locks from the outside and has one tiny window that can't be opened.

After her first night sleeping at the house, Millie wakes up to find the kitchen a wreck, with Nina throwing dishes onto the ground and screaming. Nina is only able to calm down when her husband, Andrew, runs into the kitchen and wraps her in a hug.
Although Nina seems to be a perfectly normal housewife when Millie first met her, she quickly devolves and shows that she is deeply troubled. Millie then has to deal with Nina’s ridiculous requests.

Amid Nina's crazy behaviors, Millie builds a relationship with Andrew, who understands the way Nina functions. Their relationship quickly escalates from platonic to sexual when they end up going to New York City to see a play together, and spend the night at a hotel room.
The story comes to a head when Andrew kicks Nina out of the house and says he plans on divorcing her.
What's Really Going on With Nina?

After Nina's actions reach a climax, Andrew decides to kick her out of the house, and is left alone with Millie. They are living happily together when Millie accidentally breaks a plate that belonged to Andrew's grandmother.
Andrew proceeds to lock Millie in her attic room and forces her to cut herself in the stomach with the pieces of the broken plate as a punishment.

The point of view of the film suddenly shifts from Millie's perspective to Nina's perspective. The story goes back in time to recount when single mother Nina first met Andrew and had a quick engagement and wedding. Andrew always wanted a child of their own but as viewers discover, there's a reason Nina didn't want to get pregnant.
It shows how the first few days of their marriage were picturesque, with Andrew seeming like the perfect husband before he suddenly shows his true nature.

Andrew gets upset with Nina for not keeping up the roots of her bleached blond hair and locks her in the attic room. He says that she has to repent for making a mistake and forces her to pull 100 strands of hair out of her head and place them in an envelope in order to be let out of the room.
Nina remains trapped in the room for days without access to food or water. In a feverish state, she finally gives in and completes the punishment.
For years, Nina was forced to deal with the abuse. She feared Cece would be taken away from her if she tried to leave Andrew, as everyone believes he is the perfect husband and she is the crazy wife.

However, Nina comes up with a plan to hire a housemaid, Millie, a pretty young girl with a history of violence to steal Andrew's attention. She knows that Andrew will be attracted to her and would take care of her — just like he did with Nina.
How Does ‘The Housemaid’ End?

The timeline flashes back to Millie trapped in the attic room. She has just completed her punishment and hatches a plan to get back at Andrew. She is able to trap him in the attic room and turns the table on him by forcing him to pull out his own tooth.
It is revealed that Millie was in jail for murdering a man who tried to rape her roommate when she was in high school. With this violent background, she is not afraid to stand up to Andrew's  abuse.

Nina feels guilty about leaving Millie with Andrew, knowing that he will torture her, so she goes back to the house to help her. She opens the door to the attic room, thinking that Millie was trapped in there, but actually lets Andrew out of the room.
The group physically fight one other at the top of the stairs, before Millie is able to shove Andrew over the railing, where he falls to his death.
Does Millie go Back to Jail?

After Andrew's death, the police come to the house to question Millie and Nina. The officer who questions them is suspicious because he appeared to have been stabbed in the neck (which Millie did) and fell from the top of the stairs. However, the officer explains that she knew Andrew when he was alive.
The police officer's sister had once been engaged to Andrew, but it is implied that she had broken it off after she discovered his true nature.
It is further implied that she decides to close the case because she knew about Andrew's behavior.
Nina holds a funeral for Andrew, which is attended by his vain mother, as well as the community of parents who believed he was the perfect husband.

Millie is also there and gets a large sum of money from Nina to start a new life. The film, however, ends with Millie interviewing to once again be a housemaid. The woman tells her Nina recommended her and when they are talking, Millie sees that she has bruises on her body. It is implied that Millie's services are needed beyond housekeeping.
Will There be a Sequel?
“Millie is not done,” Feig tells TODAY.com about the future of the story.
“The Housemaid” is a part of a trilogy, with the next book titled “The Housemaid’s Secret” that follows Millie as she starts to work for a new family. The third is titled “The Housemaid Is Watching.”
“We kind of get a taste of where Millie goes and what’s going on.” Sweeney tells TODAY.com. “But I want Nina to come back into her life. I feel like Millie really needs Nina.”

title: When Will 'Avatar 4' and 'Avatar 5' Be Released? What We Know
summary: The “Avatar” franchise has been captivating sci-fi film fans since the original “Avatar” movie debuted in theaters in December 2009.“Avatar” and its first sequel, “Avatar: The Way of Water,” released in 2022, together grossed $5.2 billion around the world to become the No. 1 and No. 3 highest-grossing movies of all time, according to industry site Box Office Mojo
story: The “Avatar” franchise has been captivating sci-fi film fans since the original “Avatar” movie debuted in theaters in December 2009.

“Avatar” and its first sequel, “Avatar: The Way of Water,” released in 2022, together grossed $5.2 billion around the world to become the No. 1 and No. 3 highest-grossing movies of all time, according to industry site Box Office Mojo.
Now, the franchise’s long-awaited third installment, “Avatar: Fire and Ash,” has debuted in theaters Dec. 19.

The new movie, whose release was delayed a year, brings back Sam Worthington, Zoe Saldaña, Sigourney Weaver and Stephen Lang, among other actors from the original film. It also features Kate Winslet, Edie Falco and Giovanni Ribisi, who all appeared in the 2022 sequel.
Director James Cameron has in the past promised two more “Avatar” movies are yet to come.

But in a new interview with The Hollywood Reporter published Dec. 17, Cameron said moving forward with the final two films, whose budgets would be as enormous as the first three movies, depends on the box-office success of “Avatar: Fire and Ash.”

“This can be the last one. There’s only one (unanswered question) in the story. We may find that the release of ‘Avatar 3’ proves how diminished the cinematic experience is these days, or we may find it proves the case that it’s as strong as it ever was — but only for certain types of films,” he said.
“It’s a coin toss right now,” added Cameron. “We won’t know until the middle of January.”
Here’s what we know about the possible final two installments in the “Avatar” franchise.
What Is the 'Avatar' Franchise About?

The sci-fi franchise, created by Cameron, tells the story of a group of humans in the antagonistic Resources Development Administration (RDA) who clash with indigenous humanoid called the Na’vi after greedily colonizing their moon Pandora to mine a valuable mineral.
The franchise’s long arc also features an unlikely love story between a human, Jake Sully, played by Worthington, and the Na’vi warrior Neytiri, played by Saldaña.

“Avatar: The Way of Water” introduces a new oceanic Na’vi tribe, the Metkayina clan, who live on Pandora’s reefs, as well as new sea creatures like the whale-like Tulkuns. In “Avatar: Fire and Ash,” viewers get to meet the Mangkwan clan, also known as the Ash People, who are led by their wicked leader Varang, played by Oona Chaplin.
When Will ‘Avatar 4’ Be Released?
The year delay in the release of “Avatar: Fire and Ash” pushed back the release dates of the franchise’s final two movies, Deadline reported in June 2023.
“Avatar 4,” which was originally scheduled for a December 2026 release, will now arrive in theaters in December 2029, according to Deadline.

But, as Cameron told The Hollywood Reporter in an interview published this week, he hopes the just-released “Avatar: Fire and Ash” is another box-office smash in order for him to continue with the franchise.

Still, Cameron shared tidbits about the script of “Avatar 4” with Entertainment Weekly way back in 2022, revealing that the movie would feature “a big time jump” to accommodate how much the franchise’s younger actors have aged in real life.
“They’re young men, young women at that point, when we get to the B side of that time jump,” he said.
During a 2023 appearance on “Who’s Talking to Chris Wallace,” Cameron confirmed he’d already begun working on both final films.
“‘Avatar 4’ and ‘5’ are both written. We even have some of ‘4’ in the can,” said Cameron.
“We’ve begun a franchise at this point,” he said, adding, “We can safely say we’ve begun a saga that can now play out over multiple films, which was our original goal.”

When Wallace asked if Cameron already knew the final scene of the entire franchise, Cameron responded, “Oh yeah. It’s all been written. The scripts for 2, 3, 4 and 5 were all finished over five years ago. It’s all mapped out.”
When Will ‘Avatar 5’ Be Released?
“Avatar 5,” which was originally intended to arrive in theaters in December 2028, is now set for a December 2031 release, reported Deadline.
How Will the 'Avatar' Story End?
As far as how the franchise’s story will wrap up, producer Jon Landau dropped a bombshell about the plot of “Avatar 5,” during a 2022 conversation with Gizmodo’s io9 blog.

“I wasn’t going to talk about it, but I’ve now subsequently heard that Jim (Cameron) has talked about it a little bit,” Landau said. “In movie five there is a section of the story where we go to Earth. And we go to it to open people’s eyes, open Neytiri’s eyes, to what exists on Earth.”
The journey, said Landau, will illustrate to the Na’vi that the colonizing humans in the Resources Development Administration don’t represent all humans.

“Earth is not just represented by the RDA,” he said. “Just like you’re defined by the choices you make in life, not all humans are bad. Not all Na’vi are good. And that’s the case here on Earth. And we want to expose Neytiri to that.”

title: Bowen Yang Is Exiting ‘Saturday Night Live’ After This Weekend’s Episode
summary: Bowen Yang is leaving SNL mid-season after Saturday's show with Cher and Ariana Grande. Here's everything we know so far and what the actor has said about the show.
story: Bowen Yang is saying goodbye to “Saturday Night Live.”

Yang will exit the show in the middle of his eighth season following the Dec. 20 episode — featuring his “Wicked” franchise co-star Ariana Grande as host and Cher as musical guest —TODAY.com has learned.
TODAY.com has reached out to Bowen’s rep and “SNL” for comment.
Yang joined “SNL” as a writer in 2018. He went on to become an on-air featured player the following year in Season 45. He was promoted to the main cast of the show in Season 47.

Yang’s sudden departure in Season 51 comes roughly three months after the exits of cast members Ego Nwodim, Heidi Gardner, Michael Longfellow, Devon Walker and Emil Wakim and writer John Higgins in September.
That same month, Yang opened up to People about his decision to stay on the show for another season, which came after a discussion with “SNL” creator Lorne Michaels.
“I’ve always gone by the instinct of, do I have more to do? And I feel like I do,” Yang told the outlet.

“Even Lorne and I talked about it, and Lorne was like, ‘You have more to do,’ and that means a lot, because I even confessed to him,” Yang continued. “I was like, ‘I feel the audience is maybe getting sick of me.’ And he was like, ‘That’s not true. There’s more for you to do. I need you.’”
Yang went on to say he felt he had to “honor” Michaels’ wishes.
“That man has changed my life, and I owe a lot of my life to that show. And I love working there, the people are the best. I really love each of them so much,” he explained.

During his time on “SNL,” Yang was known for being a versatile cast member. He showcased his own zany sense of humor in several memorable moments at the “Weekend Update” desk as the iceberg that sank the Titanic and Moo Deng.
Yang also told People he considered being a cast member on “SNL” a kind of “boot camp” for young entertainers, which, he said, “implies that there is a next phase you train for something else.”

“It’s always a transitional place, and I think it is always a launching pad,” he said, adding, “I think that’s going to be true for all of the people who aren’t coming back. I’m so excited to see what they do. I’m excited for the new cast.”

title: Taylor Swift’s Mom Says Travis Kelce Won Her Over With This 1 Green Flag — Before They Even Met
summary: After Travis Kelce made a grand romantic gesture for Taylor Swift, the singer’s mother helped encourage her daughter to give the football player a chance.
story: After Travis Kelce made a grand romantic gesture for Taylor Swift, the singer’s mother helped encourage her daughter to give the football player a chance.
In Episode 4 of Swift’s “The End of an Era“ docuseries on Disney+, Andrea Swift recalled how she’s always been Team Travis.

“I’m looking at the headlines and perusing around what’s on the internet,” she said as she recounted the story backstage to Swift, alongside her brother Austin and publicist Tree Paine. “I see that this guy came to your show, and he brought a friendship bracelet and wants to meet you.”

In 2023, Kelce attended one of Taylor Swift’s concerts and attempted to give the singer a friendship bracelet with his phone number on it. Alas, he learned that she wasn’t meeting with anyone before or after the show in an effort to conserve her voice for the concert, which lasted over three hours.
Kelce had shared about his efforts on his “New Heights” podcast and admitted that he was “a little butt hurt” that he didn’t get to meet Taylor Swift.
After Andrea Swift heard about Kelce’s attempt to meet her daughter, she started investigating her would-be suitor.

“And so, of course, I call up my resident expert on (the) Kansas City Chiefs, my cousin Robin, and I go, ‘Tell me about this guy named Travis Kelce,’” she recalled. “And she goes, ‘Oh, my God, he’s the nicest guy. And you know what, he really loves his mom.’ And I went, ding, ding, ding, ding. Then I said, ‘Now, how in the world am I going to get her to meet him?’”
Taylor Swift then explained that she was never interested in dating athletes.

“I’ve been very non-athlete because I’m not one, and I’ve always just been like, ‘Well, what would we talk about?’” she said to her mom. “And so you call me up with this tone of like, ‘Hey, so I know you’re going to not react well to this, but there’s a guy ...’”
“He’s really cute!” Andrea Swift added.
“You said something to the effect of like, ‘You gotta start doing something different,’” Taylor Swift recalled.
Andrea Swift then explained why she was so impressed with Kelce’s romantic gesture.
“Listen, it was so earnest. I thought it was the sweetest thing in the world that he came to your show. He brought you something from your world. To me, that really said a lot,” she said.
Taylor Swift did decide to give Kelce a try and after nearly two years of dating they announced their engagement in August 2025.

“On our first date, he literally had to explain football as if it were, like, violent chess,” she recalled. “Which helps me kind of understand it. Like high-speed, angry chess. And then I just sort of became obsessed with him and therefore became obsessed with learning about football. Greatest surprise of my life.”
In the end, the pop star’s mother also approves of her relationship.

“He really is one of the happiest people I think I’ve ever met, which I adore. He just brought a lot of happiness, which is I think what he does in a lot of his circles. He brings a lot of happiness to the world,” she said in the doc.
While reflecting on her romantic life before Kelce, Swift said she always struggled to balance her relationships with her career. However, the dynamic changed when she met Kelce.

“I don’t think I thought I’d ever meet a guy who had that same (career) trajectory. And I realized that with this person in my life that just was the right fit for me. You can have the two passions coexist and they actually fuel each other,” she said.

title: Does ‘Avatar: Fire and Ash’ Have a Post-Credits Scene? The Ending Explained
summary: "Avatar: Fire and Ash" is now in theaters. Find out what happens at the end and if there is a post-credit scene in the third "Avatar" film.
story: Warning: Spoilers ahead for “Avatar: Fire and Ash.”
James Cameron’s epic sci-fi and fantasy franchise “Avatar” continues with its third installment “Avatar: Fire and Ash.”

Audiences head back to Pandora as Marine-turned-Na’vi leader Jake Sully (Sam Worthington) and Na’vi warrior Neytiri (Zoe Saldaña), along with their family, encounter and fight against a new and aggressive Na’vi tribe.

“Fire and Ash” comes after 2009’s “Avatar” and 2022’s “Avatar: The Way of Water,” which introduced the aquatic Metkayina tribe and the Tulkun, the large whale-like species that is native to Pandora’s oceans.

The third film finds Jake, Neytiri and their kids still grieving from the death of their son and brother Neteyam (Jamie Flatters), who was shot while trying to save his younger brother Lo’ak (Britain Dalton) and Miles “Spider” Socorro (Jack Champion) from the Resources Development Administration, aka the RDA, in the second film.

Now, trying to find peace, the Na’vi are once again under attack from the humans and Colonel Miles Quaritch (Stephen Lang), who enlists the vengeful Mangkwan clan, also known as the Ash People, to capture Sully and Quaritch’s son Spider. The Ash People are led by their evil leader Varang (Oona Chaplin).
So as the war wages on, here is what happens at the end of “Avatar: Fire and Ash.”
What Happens at the End of 'Avatar: Fire and Ash'?
Throughout the film, Kiri (Sigourney Weaver) has been exploring her power and attempting to connect with the spirit world and Pandora’s deity, Eywa.

The humans and Quaritch are also on the hunt for Jake, who eventually surrenders to them when his family is in danger and after they have captured Spider. Scientists want to use Spider after he acquires an ability to breathe on Pandora without an oxygen mask, thanks to the mycelium that has invaded his body when Kiri tried to save his life.

An injured, healing and angry Neytiri infiltrates the RDA’s facilities to rescue Jake. She is successful thanks to the help of Spider, who broke out of his cell, and marine biologist Dr. Ian Garvin (Jemaine Clement), who is against the humans killing Tulkun.

Meanwhile, the RDA has big plans to kill dozens of Tulkun, whose brains carry amrita, a substance that stops humans from aging.
